name: The Hassan Foundation
mission: TO PROMOTE HUMAN DEVELOPMENT BY PRESERVING LIFE THROUGH IMPROVING HEALTH AND EDUCATION AMONGST THE POOR PEOPLE IN PAKISTAN. TO PROVIDE CLEAN POTABLE WAT...
theoryOfChange: Providing clean water reduces disease and frees time for education; supporting orphans' education breaks the cycle of poverty; vocational training creates economic independence.
zakatClaimEvidence: The Hassan Foundation explicitly states, "Will my donation be zakat eligible? All of Hassan Foundation's projects are exclusively for zakat-eligible people." Additionally, they mention, "In addition to receiving donations and zakat money, Hassan Foundation collects funds through our annual fundraising event". (Source: https://hassanfoundationusa.org/donate/)

dimension_explanations.alignment: With a high alignment score of 34/50, the foundation is a strong fit for donors seeking to fulfill religious obligations, as it is Zakat-eligible and addresses urgent cultural and religious causes [1][3]. The mission focuses specifically on the poor in Pakistan, providing a clear track record for donors interested in international development and health [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization operates as a direct service provider with an impact score of 32/50, maintaining an 88.2% program expense ratio to fund safe water and education projects [2][3]. While financial health is robust with 99.7 months of working capital, the low data confidence score of 0.26 suggests a need for more transparent evidence of long-term effectiveness [3].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Hassan Foundation provides life-saving clean water and educational support to underserved communities in Pakistan.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 88.2%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach those in need
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity with 99.7 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: The Hassan Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to improving health and education for the poor in Pakistan through clean water projects and school support [2]. With a total revenue of $586,737, the organization focuses on preserving life by increasing access to potable water and human development initiatives [2][3].

rich_narrative.headline: The Hassan Foundation provides life-saving clean water and educational support to underserved communities in Pakistan.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support highly efficient, direct-service humanitarian projects in Pakistan and value organizations with extremely low overhead.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations with a focus on Pakistan
Prioritize charities with maximum program expense ratios
Value lean operations with minimal fundraising costs
giving_considerations: The organization holds significant reserves, meaning current donations may not be deployed immediately
Limited third-party evidence of long-term impact
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking organizations with rigorous, independent impact evaluations or those who prefer immediate deployment of all contributed funds.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization tracks basic outputs but lacks rigorous, independent evaluations of long-term outcomes.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The organization aims to promote human development by preserving life through improving health and education amongst the poor in Pakistan.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Rigorous evidence ensures that interventions are genuinely improving lives and that resources are allocated effectively.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The organization holds 99.7 months of working capital, suggesting it has significant capacity to fund current operations without immediate new revenue.

The organization's fundraising efforts are exceptionally lean, costing <cite id="3">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. Additionally, the charity maintains a robust financial position with <cite id="3">99.7 months of working capital</cite>, though this level of reserves suggests an opportunity to deploy more funds toward immediate program needs.
rich_narrative.summary: The Hassan Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to improving health and education for underserved communities in Pakistan. With <cite id="2">$586,737 in total revenue</cite> for the 2022 tax year, the organization focuses on preserving life by increasing access to potable water and human development initiatives. The charity operates primarily through direct service delivery, maintaining a <cite id="2">88.2% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach those in need. The foundation is <cite id="1">zakat-eligible</cite> and serves the fuqara and masakin categories. The organization demonstrates exceptional fundraising efficiency, spending <cite id="3">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>.
